text:
September 7, 1955
Mr. James S. Miles
Director
Radio Station WBAA
Purdue University
Lafayette, Indiana
Dear Jimt
After getting your letter about tbs billing for the mailing labels, I
waited until both Harry and I were in the office to take any action.
(Up until yesterday I hadn’t seen Harry since August 5, due to both of
us being gone quite a bit.)
Me have now talked this matter over and decided that I acted rather hastily
and that we should not bill you for the labels, since you are actually
performing a service forus rather than vice versa.
The girl who does the billing isn’t in the office right now, but I don’t
think I had asked her to bill you as yet. However, in case you do get a
bill, just send it back to me and I'll have it cancelled.
Sorry to have appeared ungrateful for your services, past and present - we
really appreciate all you are doing to help the operation here.
Regards to Elizabeth and Ricky. Incidentally, am enclosing the $1.00 you
loaned me at the July 4th celebration. Am embarrassed that it has slipped
my mind until now. At any rate, belated thanks, and I trust my credit
rating isn't too badly impaired.
Regards,
HEHjjy
Enclosure
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
